top_comment.text:
Hi Grace! Just wanted to give you a little history on this movie that you 
might find interesting. The screenwriter for the movie originally wrote 
this as a short story (also called 'Cake') that appeared in The Kenyon 
Review. In the original story, the main character is deeply unlikable and 
has almost no redeeming qualities. It actually made the story very hard to 
read, because it was obvious that she was in a tremendous amount of pain, 
but was so awful to everyone around her that it was very hard to sympathize 
with her. For example, in the story she get's Nina's address by threatening 
to sue the support group for emotional distress. Looking at the movie, it's 
obvious they softened the character a lot and I'm guessing they might have 
tweaked the ending to make it more palatable. 

Sorry for the long comment, but I got super excited when I recognized the 
story and thought you might think its path to becoming a movie was 
interesting too. Have a good one!﻿
top_comment.author: Erik Rinard

top_comment.text:
I had to drop everything and comment here. No competition in the Best 
Actress category? There's is something negative here. There were many 
excellent performances given by females this year and it is highly 
competitive. You have Moore, Reese, Pike as the top three names that keep 
showing up on critics list. Just this mornign I read Scarlett made the 
short list in the WA DC critics short list for Best Actress. There are many 
performances worthy of recognition and to peddle the notion that it's 
sparse or dry is a bit embarrassing imo. ﻿
top_comment.author: Will R

comments.text:
+JustinHenryfan a dvdscr of cake is out on Torrent. Predestianation wasn't 
an Oscar worthy movie but the Maine heroine did an outstanding performance.
comments.author: Ri Gil

comments.text:
I disagree. It's a common concensus that the Best Actress cathegory this 
year is weak, weak, weak. First of all there's is a lack of female centered 
movies this year. There's Gone Girl, Wild, Still Alice and Cake that are 
about it, of course there is still Two Days One Night, but that's not a 
Hollywood movie and The Hundred-Foot Journey, Under the Skin and so on, but 
they aren't considered Oscar-worthy stuff. And of these movies, I've seen 
Gone Girl and Still Alice and I hated them both. And to be perfectly frank 
I think Still Alice is only an awards contender because of Moore's lack of 
an Oscar, her performance in the film isn't even that particularly good, 
Still Alice, very much like Cake seems to be - I don't know yet, since I 
have not yet seen Cake, but Still Alice is a cry-shout to the Academy for 
an Oscar for Julianne, that's it, it's not a good film. So we basically 
just have Rosamund Pike and Reese Witherspoon as the leading ladies of 
hailed movies. That's not much! And if we look at the Best Actor race - it 
could not be more tense. Filled with great performances and I feel like in 
a normal year, even Matthew McConaughey from Interstellar could be in 
consideration but this year, it looks like, he has no hope of winning. 
There is Michael Keaton - a frontrunner for the win, Jake Gyllenhaal, David 
Oyelowo, Eddie Redmayne, Benedict Cumberbatch, Steve Carell, Channing 
Tatum, Ralph Fiennes, Jack O'Connel, Gael Garcia Bernal, Oscar Isaac, 
Timothy Spall, Chadwick Boseman, Bradley Cooper, Tom Hardy and Brendan 
Gleeson, this list not even including Kevin Costner, the cast of Fury, Mark 
Wahlberg, James Corden - so that's 16 men and 2 women. - well if you 
include Johansson, Cotillard, Felicity Jones maybe, and fine, Julianne 
Moore - it's still 6 women, I'd say it's a pretty weak competition... 
ESPECIALLY when the predicted winner is someone who would be getting it as 
a "career award" not for the performance itself.
comments.author: JustinHenryfan

captions.text: I made a list and I've checked on the internet to see if they were different in Mexico...
Trying to sedate a small city?
I want you to verbalize to Nina
She jumped off a freeway overpass
her body got stuck in customs for like a week
before Nina's husband could even claim it
Spread your legs a little big wider.
Shouldn't we go on a date first?
Uh listen, you think I could come by and pick up the rest of my stuff?
I think it's prudent that we don't see each other.
I came here for Nina's address.
I can't give you that information.
I actually brought you a really nice bottle of vodka...
I mean, not in the traditional sense.
Y'know you just coulda said you wanted to come over.
Yeah but what's the fun in that?
What are you doing?  He doesn't even like you.
If I could switch places, I would. I wanted to tell you -
I am in a lot of pain.
Do you want to get better?
